item.title: Megan add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "I cannot live without books." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Megan add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Megan add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "If we couldn't laugh we would all go insane." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Megan add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "There is no Frigate like a Book To take us Lands away, Nor any Coursers like a Page Of prancing Poetry – This Traverse may the poorest take Without oppress of Toll – How frugal is the Chariot That bears a Human soul." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Megan add a quote by John F. Kennedy
item.description: "Forgive your enemies, but never forget their names." -- John F. Kennedy

item.title: Megan add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "We are all born ignorant, but one must work hard to remain stupid." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Megan add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Megan add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Megan add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Megan add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "What really knocks me out is a book that, when you're all done reading it, you wish the author that wrote it was a terrific friend of yours and you could call him up on the phone whenever you felt like it. That doesn't happen much, though." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Megan add a quote by J. D. Salinger
item.description: "Don't ever tell anybody anything. If you do, you start missing everybody." -- J. D. Salinger

item.title: Megan add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "I'm the most terrific liar you ever saw in your life. It's awful. If I'm on my way to the store to buy a magazine, even, and somebody asks me where I'm going, I'm liable to say I'm going to the opera. It's terrible." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Megan add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "Among other things, you'll find that you're not the first person who was ever confused and frightened and even sickened by human behavior. You're by no means alone on that score, you'll be excited and stimulated to know. Many, many men have been just as troubled morally and spiritually as you are right now. Happily, some of them kept records of their troubles. You'll learn from them—if you want to. Just as someday, if you have something to offer, someone will learn something from you. It's a beautiful reciprocal arrangement. And it isn't education. It's history. It's poetry." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Megan add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "People always clap for the wrong reasons." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Megan add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "Grand. There's a word I really hate. It's a phony. I could puke every time I hear it." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Megan add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "It's funny. All you have to do is say something nobody understands and they'll do practically anything you want them to." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Megan add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "When you're dead, they really fix you up. I hope to hell when I do die somebody has sense enough to just dump me in the river or something. Anything except sticking me in a goddam cemetery. People coming and putting a bunch of flowers on your stomach on Sunday, and all that crap. Who wants flowers when you're dead? Nobody." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Megan add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "All morons hate it when you call them a moron. .." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Megan add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "People are always ruining things for you." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Megan add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "It's not too bad when the sun's out, but the sun only comes out when it feels like coming out." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Megan add a quote by J. D. Salinger
item.description: "Anyway, I keep picturing all these little kids playing some game in this big field of rye and all. Thousands of little kids, and nobody's around - nobody big, I mean - except me. And I'm standing on the edge of some crazy cliff. What I have to do, I have to catch everybody if they start to go over the cliff - I mean if they're running and they don't look where they're going I have to come out from somewhere and catch them. That's all I do all day. I'd just be the catcher in the rye and all. I know it's crazy, but that's the only thing I'd really like to be." -- J. D. Salinger

item.title: Megan add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "when you're not looking, somebody'll sneak up and write "Fuck you" right under your nose." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Megan add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "Sex is something I really don't understand too hot. You never know where the hell you are... Sex is something I just don't understand. I swear to God." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Megan add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "Certain things, they should stay the way they are. You ought to be able to stick them in one of those big glass cases and just leave them alone." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Megan add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "This fall I think you're riding for—it's a special kind of fall, a horrible kind. The man falling isn't permitted to feel or hear himself hit bottom. He just keeps falling and falling. The whole arrangement's designed for men who, at some time or other in their lives, were looking for something their own environment couldn't supply them with. Or they thought their own environment couldn't supply them with. So they gave up looking. They gave it up before they ever really even got started." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Megan add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "People never notice anything." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Megan add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "I am always saying "Glad to've met you" to somebody I'm not at all glad I met. If you want to stay alive, you have to say that stuff, though." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Megan add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "And I have one of those very loud, stupid laughs. I mean if I ever sat behind myself in a movie or something, I'd probably lean over and tell myself to please shut up." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Megan add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "If you really want to hear about it, the first thing you'll probably want to know is where I was born, and what my lousy childhood was like, and how my parents were occupied and all before they had me, and all that David Copperfield kind of crap, but I don't feel like going into it, if you want to know the truth." -- J.D. Salinger
